phrases, collocations.meaning: get/grow old (trở nên già), old age (tuổi già), old folks (người già), old hand (người dày dạn), old-fashioned (cổ hủ), old money (gia đình giàu lâu đời), old flame (tình cũ), old-fashioned ideas (tư tưởng cổ hủ)
phrases, collocations.example: He’s getting old but still strong. She’s an old hand at negotiation.

phrases, collocations.meaning: on purpose (cố tình), on your own (tự mình), on and on (dài dòng mãi), on the one/other hand (một mặt/mặt khác), on top (trên đầu), on time (đúng giờ), on demand (khi cần), on loan (cho mượn)
phrases, collocations.example: I didn’t do it on purpose. She arrived on time. This book is on loan from the library.

phrases, collocations.meaning: opt for (chọn thứ gì), opt to do (chọn làm gì)
phrases, collocations.example: She opted for the vegetarian dish. I opted to stay at home.

phrases, collocations.meaning: have no option (but to) (không còn lựa chọn nào), consider your options (cân nhắc lựa chọn), keep/leave your options open (giữ lựa chọn), the option of doing (lựa chọn làm việc gì), the option to do (lựa chọn để làm gì)
phrases, collocations.example: We had no option but to leave. I’m keeping my options open for now.

phrases, collocations.meaning: piece/sheet of paper (mảnh/giấy), present/write/set a paper on (trình bày/viết đề tài), paper round (nghề phát báo), paper qualifications (bằng cấp giấy), paperwork (công việc giấy tờ)
phrases, collocations.example: Please fill out this sheet of paper. He gave a paper on renewable energy.

phrases, collocations.meaning: come to an end (kết thúc), bring sth to an end (kết thúc việc gì), put an end to sth (chấm dứt), at an end (đã kết thúc), (for) hours/weeks/etc on end (liên tục hàng giờ/ngày/tuần...)
phrases, collocations.example: The meeting finally came to an end. We must put an end to this behavior. She studied for hours on end.

phrases, collocations.meaning: have/lack the energy to do (có/thiếu năng lượng làm gì), put/energy into (dồn năng lượng vào), source of energy (nguồn năng lượng), nuclear/alternative/renewable energy (năng lượng hạt nhân/thay thế/tái tạo)
phrases, collocations.example: I didn’t have the energy to cook. He puts a lot of energy into his work. Solar power is a renewable energy source.

phrases, collocations.meaning: call for/equal/same quality/value (có chất lượng/tương đương), equal in size/etc (bằng kích thước...), roughly equal to (tương đương với), of equal size/quality/value (có cùng kích thước/chất lượng)
phrases, collocations.example: Both tasks are equal in difficulty. His salary is roughly equal to mine. These shoes are of equal size.

phrases, collocations.meaning: erect (a statue/monument/etc) (dựng tượng), erect posture (tư thế thẳng)
phrases, collocations.example: They erected a statue in her honor. He stood with an erect posture during the ceremony.

phrases, collocations.meaning: hardly ever (hầu như không bao giờ), if ever (nếu có thì cũng hiếm), first/only/last time ever (lần đầu/duy nhất/cuối cùng), bigger/better/etc than ever (lớn hơn/tốt hơn bao giờ hết), as ever (như thường lệ)
phrases, collocations.example: I hardly ever go to the gym. It was the first time ever I met him. She's as friendly as ever.

phrases, collocations.meaning: an example of (một ví dụ về), follow an example (làm gương), set an example (làm gương), classic/prime example (ví dụ điển hình/điển hình nhất)
phrases, collocations.example: He set a good example for his peers. This is a classic example of poor planning.

phrases, collocations.meaning: fall ill (ngã bệnh), fall in love (yêu), fall into a category (thuộc loại), fall short (thiếu hụt), fall asleep (ngủ gật), fall to pieces (sụp đổ)
phrases, collocations.example: She fell in love while traveling. He fell asleep during the movie. The plan fell to pieces at the last moment.

phrases, collocations.meaning: start a family (bắt đầu một gia đình), nuclear/extended family (gia đình hạt nhân/mở rộng), close/near/distant relative (họ hàng gần/xa), family friend (bạn của gia đình), family name (họ), family tree (cây gia phả)
phrases, collocations.example: They plan to start a family next year. She drew her family tree. He’s a close family friend.

phrases, collocations.meaning: get/grow fat (trở nên giàu có/mập), fat chance (khó có thể xảy ra), a fat lot of good (không hề hữu ích)
phrases, collocations.example: Fat chance he’ll agree to it! That expensive car did a fat lot of good stuck in traffic.

phrases, collocations.meaning: feature in sth (nổi bật trong), a feature of (đặc điểm của), distinguishing feature (đặc điểm nổi bật), safety feature (tính năng an toàn), feature writer (tác giả bài nổi bật)
phrases, collocations.example: The curved roof is a feature of this design. She works as a feature writer for the magazine.

phrases, collocations.meaning: feel like doing (cảm thấy muốn làm), feel as if/though (cảm giác như), feel strongly about (cảm thấy mạnh mẽ về), feel the effects/benefits (cảm nhận ảnh hưởng/lợi ích), feel guilty/nervous/etc (cảm thấy tội lỗi...), feel at home (cảm thấy tự nhiên)
phrases, collocations.example: I feel like taking a nap. I feel as if I’ve forgotten something. She felt the benefits of the new workout.

phrases, collocations.meaning: find yourself doing (tự dưng làm gì), find sb doing sth (bắt gặp ai đó), find it difficult to do (gặp khó khăn khi làm), find your way (tìm đường/giải pháp)
phrases, collocations.example: I found myself staring at the stars. She found him sleeping on the sofa. I can’t find my way in this city.

phrases, collocations.meaning: cut it fine (xoay sở làm vừa kịp), fine sb for sth (phạt vì...), a heavy/small fine (mức phạt nặng/nhẹ)
phrases, collocations.example: He was fined for speeding. They cut it fine but still made the train.

phrases, collocations.meaning: take the floor (lên phát biểu), floor show (buổi biểu diễn trên sàn), ground/first/etc floor (tầng trệt/thứ nhất...), floor plan (sơ đồ tầng)
phrases, collocations.example: He took the floor to address the issue. The apartment is on the second floor.

phrases, collocations.meaning: fly a flag/kite (treo cờ/thả diều), fly at sb (tấn công ai), fly open (mở toang), fly by (trôi qua nhanh chóng)
phrases, collocations.example: The kite flew high in the sky. Time flew by during the holidays.

phrases, collocations.meaning: focus on (tập trung vào), the focus of (tiêu điểm của...), in focus/out of focus (rõ/mờ), focus group (nhóm thảo luận)
phrases, collocations.example: Let’s focus on the task at hand. The main focus of the meeting was safety.

phrases, collocations.meaning: fold sth in half/two (gấp đôi), fold sth neatly/carefully (gấp gọn/gấp cẩn thận), fold flat (gấp phẳng)
phrases, collocations.example: Fold the paper in half. Please fold your clothes neatly.

phrases, collocations.meaning: follow sb's advice (nghe lời ai), follow sb's argument (hiểu luận điểm), follow sb's lead (theo sau), follow sb's example (noi gương), as follows (như sau), follow suit (làm theo)
phrases, collocations.example: He followed her advice and succeeded. The team followed suit after the leader’s move.

phrases, collocations.meaning: form an impression of (hình thành ấn tượng), take/assume the form of (có hình dạng...), in the form of (dưới dạng...), application form (mẫu đơn), good/bad form (cách hành xử tốt/xấu)
phrases, collocations.example: I formed a good impression of her. Please complete this application form.

phrases, collocations.meaning: lay the foundations (đặt nền móng), foundation course (khóa học cơ sở), foundation stone (viên đá nền tảng)
phrases, collocations.example: They laid the foundations for future success. I’m taking a foundation course in art.

phrases, collocations.meaning: set sb free (thả ai đó tự do), let sb go free (thả ai), walk free (tự do đi lại), free sb from sth (giải thoát), free to do (tự do làm gì), free and easy (thoải mái), feel free (cứ tự nhiên)
phrases, collocations.example: They were finally set free. Feel free to contact us anytime.

phrases, collocations.meaning: fresh air (không khí trong lành), fresh-faced (tươi tắn), fresh start (khởi đầu mới), fresh from (vừa mới từ), fresh out of (vừa hết), fresh water (nước ngọt)
phrases, collocations.example: Let’s go outside for some fresh air. She’s fresh from university.

phrases, collocations.meaning: be/friend sb (kết bạn), close/good/great friend (bạn thân), mutual friend (bạn chung), circle of friends (vòng bạn bè), friends with sb (là bạn với ai)
phrases, collocations.example: He’s a close friend of mine. We met through a mutual friend.

phrases, collocations.meaning: the older/younger generation (thế hệ già/trẻ), generation gap (khoảng cách thế hệ), generation X (thế hệ X), future generations (những thế hệ tương lai)
phrases, collocations.example: There’s a clear generation gap in values. We must protect the environment for future generations.

phrases, collocations.meaning: accept/face the consequences (chấp nhận/hứng chịu hậu quả), serious/disastrous/negative consequences (hậu quả nghiêm trọng), direct consequence of (hậu quả trực tiếp), in consequence of (vì lý do), of no/little consequence (không/không quá quan trọng)
phrases, collocations.example: You must face the consequences of your actions. The accident was a direct consequence of poor planning. His opinion is of no consequence to me.

phrases, collocations.meaning: take into consideration (cân nhắc), give consideration to (xem xét), show consideration for (quan tâm tới), under consideration (được xem xét), for consideration (để cân nhắc), out of consideration for (vì cân nhắc tới ai)
phrases, collocations.example: We must take all factors into consideration before deciding. She always shows consideration for others. Your suggestion is under consideration.

phrases, collocations.meaning: in the course of (trong suốt quá trình), course of action/events (diễn biến hành động/sự kiện)
phrases, collocations.example: In the course of the investigation, new evidence came to light. We must decide the best course of action.

phrases, collocations.meaning: commit/permit/witness/solve a crime (thực hiện/cho phép/chứng kiến/giải quyết một tội ác), fight/combat crime (chống tội phạm), crime rate (tỉ lệ tội phạm), organised crime (tội phạm có tổ chức)
phrases, collocations.example: He committed a serious crime last year. The government is taking steps to combat organised crime. The city’s crime rate has dropped.

phrases, collocations.meaning: cry with pain/happiness/laughter (khóc vì...), cry over/about (khóc vì), cry for help (kêu cứu), cry your eyes/heart out (khóc nhiều), have a good cry (khóc thỏa thích), burst into tears (bật khóc)
phrases, collocations.example: She burst into tears at the news. He cried for help when he fell. I needed to have a good cry after the breakup.

phrases, collocations.meaning: date from (bắt đầu xuất hiện từ), date back to (có từ khi), keep sth up to date (cập nhật), set/fix a date (chọn ngày), go on/make a date with sb (hẹn hò), at a later/future date (một ngày nào đó trong tương lai), to date (đến nay)
phrases, collocations.example: The building dates back to the 18th century. Please keep your records up to date. We haven’t set a date for the wedding yet.

phrases, collocations.meaning: make sb’s day (khiến ai đó hạnh phúc), by day (ban ngày), any day now (sắp tới, bất cứ lúc nào), from day to day (từng ngày), day by day (ngày qua ngày), day off (ngày nghỉ), day trip (chuyến đi trong ngày)
phrases, collocations.example: The kind words really made my day. He works by day and studies by night. We're planning a day trip to the countryside.

phrases, collocations.meaning: go dead (tắt, ngừng hoạt động), drop dead (đột nhiên lăn ra chết), dead silence (sự im lặng tuyệt đối), dead tired (mệt lả), dead and gone (biến mất, không còn nữa), dead ahead (ngay phía trước mặt)
phrases, collocations.example: The phone line suddenly went dead. I was dead tired after the hike. There was dead silence in the room.

phrases, collocations.meaning: deal in (buôn bán), deal with (giải quyết), deal a blow to (giáng một đòn vào), get a good deal on (mua được giá tốt), give sb a good deal (cho ai đó thỏa thuận tốt), great deal of sth (rất nhiều)
phrases, collocations.example: She deals in antiques. We need to deal with this problem quickly. He got a good deal on his new car.

phrases, collocations.meaning: decide on sb/sth (quyết định chọn), decide against (quyết định không), decide in favour of (quyết định ủng hộ), decide for yourself (tự quyết định), decision to do (quyết định làm gì)
phrases, collocations.example: They decided against buying the house. You need to decide for yourself. We made the decision to expand the business.

phrases, collocations.meaning: partly/mainly/all about (một phần/đa phần/toàn bộ về), do sth about (làm gì đó để xử lý), about to do (sắp làm gì)
phrases, collocations.example: She was about to leave when the phone rang. This book is all about courage and persistence. What are you going to do about the issue?

phrases, collocations.meaning: have/gain/provide access to (có/đạt được/cung cấp sự tiếp cận), Internet access (truy cập mạng Internet), wheelchair access (lối đi dành cho xe lăn)
phrases, collocations.example: Students have access to all library materials online. Wheelchair access is available at the entrance. Only members can gain access to the archive.

phrases, collocations.meaning: account for (chiếm), give an account of (kể lại/thuat lai), take into account (tính đến, cân nhắc), on account of (xem xét, chiếu cố), on account of (bởi vì), by all accounts (theo những gì thu thập được), on sb’s account (theo như ý kiến của họ)
phrases, collocations.example: He gave an account of his experience to the class. We must take weather conditions into account.By all accounts, she’s a talented writer.

phrases, collocations.meaning: in good/bad faith (hành vi thiện/chưa thiện), out of desperation/necessity (hành động tuyệt vọng/cần thiết), act on sb’s advice/orders/behalf (hành động dựa vào lời khuyên/mệnh lệnh/thay mặt ai), act out of (hành động vì lý do gì), act the part/role of (đóng vai), act like (cư xử như), act your age (cư xử đúng tuổi), in the act of doing (đang làm việc gì đó thì bị bắt gặp)
phrases, collocations.example: He was caught in the act of stealing. She acted on her lawyer’s advice. They acted out of desperation.

phrases, collocations.meaning: act your age (hành động đúng độ tuổi), under age (chưa đủ tuổi), old age (tuổi già), working/retirement age (độ tuổi đi làm/nghỉ hưu), age limit (độ tuổi giới hạn), age bracket/group (nhóm tuổi), in Stone/Bronze/Iron Age (Vào thời kỳ Đồ Đá/Đồ Đồng/Đồ Sắt)
phrases, collocations.example: She retired at the age of 65. He's not allowed in; he's under age. We studied tools from the Bronze Age.

phrases, collocations.meaning: take/spend ages (doing) (tốn nhiều thời gian làm gì); ages ago (rất lâu về trước); seems/feels like ages (có vẻ đã lâu lắm rồi kể từ khi)
phrases, collocations.example: I spent ages trying to fix that bug before I finally gave up. They moved here ages ago and still love it. It feels like ages since we last spoke. She thinks it’s been ages since her last vacation.

phrases, collocations.meaning: answer to sb (trả lời ai đó); give sb an answer (đáp lại lời); answer sb’s prayers (đáp lại lời cầu nguyện); answer the description of (rất giống với); have a lot to answer for (chịu trách nhiệm về)
phrases, collocations.example: Could you please answer my question about the API design? He finally answered her prayers by approving the budget. His work answers the description of an ideal solution. The manager will have a lot to answer for if the project fails.

phrases, collocations.meaning: argument (with sb) (cãi vã với ai); win/lose an argument (thắng/thua một cuộc tranh cãi); argument about/over (cuộc tranh luận về); argument for/against (lập luận ủng hộ/chống); without an argument (không cần bàn cãi)
phrases, collocations.example: They had an argument about which framework to use. She won the argument by presenting clear data. There’s a strong argument for adopting microservices. We resolved the issue without an argument.

phrases, collocations.meaning: arm sb with (trang bị cho ai đó); arm yourself against (trang bị cho bản thân để chống lại); take up arms (chuẩn bị chiến đấu); lay down arms (vứt bỏ vũ khí); arms control (kiểm soát vũ khí)
phrases, collocations.example: The guide armed us with all the necessary credentials. They taught us how to arm ourselves against cyber attacks. Rebels decided to lay down arms and negotiate. An international treaty on arms control was signed.

phrases, collocations.meaning: art of doing (nghệ thuật/kỹ thuật làm việc gì); art deco (trang trí nghệ thuật); art gallery (phòng trưng bày nghệ thuật); art house (phim nghệ thuật)
phrases, collocations.example: He mastered the art of debugging complex code. The building’s façade is a beautiful example of art deco. Let's visit the new art gallery this weekend. They screened an indie film at the local art house.

phrases, collocations.meaning: ask yourself (tự hỏi bản thân); ask sb a favour (nhờ ai giúp đỡ); ask sb over/round (mời đến nhà chơi); ask sb in (mời ai vào nhà); asking for trouble (chắc chắn gặp rắc rối); if you ask me (theo tôi)
phrases, collocations.example: Ask yourself what the user really needs from this feature. Could I ask you a favour and review my pull request? She asked him over for afternoon tea. If you ask me, we should refactor this module.

phrases, collocations.meaning: associate sth with (liên kết cái gì với)
phrases, collocations.example: Most people associate JavaScript with web development. He associates deadlines with unnecessary stress. Don’t associate code quality solely with performance.

phrases, collocations.meaning: have the authority to do (có thẩm quyền làm việc gì); grant sb the authority to do (trao quyền cho ai làm gì); local authority (chính quyền địa phương)
phrases, collocations.example: Only the admin has the authority to modify user roles. The board granted her the authority to approve budgets. Please consult the local authority for compliance guidelines. He assumed authority over the new deployment process.

phrases, collocations.meaning: back into sth (lùi vào chỗ nào đó); back onto sth (lùi xe lên trên cái gì); back out of (chống lưng/ứng hộ cho ai làm gì)
phrases, collocations.example: He accidentally backed into the server rack. The car backed onto the loading dock. She refused to back out of her commitment. We need someone to back us up on this proposal.

phrases, collocations.meaning: go bad (thiu, hỏng); bad for sb (có hại cho ai); bad at sth (kém về cái gì); bad blood (mối quan hệ xấu)
phrases, collocations.example: Don’t eat that milk—it’s gone bad. Smoking is bad for your health. He’s bad at estimating project timelines. There’s some bad blood between those two teams.

phrases, collocations.meaning: strike a balance (tìm phương án cân bằng); upset/restore the balance (phá vỡ/khôi phục cân bằng); balance between (cân bằng giữa); off balance (mất thăng bằng)
phrases, collocations.example: We need to strike a balance between speed and quality. A sudden spike in traffic upset the balance of the system. There’s a fine balance between innovation and risk. The unexpected outage threw the team off balance.

phrases, collocations.meaning: on a basis (trên cơ sở); on a daily/temporary basis (hàng ngày/tạm thời); on the basis of (dựa trên cơ sở)
phrases, collocations.example: We review performance on a monthly basis. The feature is enabled on a temporary basis. Decisions are made on the basis of user feedback.

phrases, collocations.meaning: behaviour towards (hành vi đối với); antisocial/violent behaviour (hành vi chống đối/bạo lực); exemplary behaviour (hành vi gương mẫu)
phrases, collocations.example: His behaviour towards colleagues was exemplary. The test revealed some antisocial behaviour in the AI agent. Good behaviour is rewarded in our performance reviews.

phrases, collocations.meaning: express belief(s) (bộc lộ niềm tin); contrary to popular belief (ngược với niềm tin chung); firm belief (niềm tin vững chắc)
phrases, collocations.example: The CEO expressed her firm belief in the project’s success. Contrary to popular belief, code reviews improve productivity. He couldn’t hide his belief in the new framework.

phrases, collocations.meaning: bend sth into (uốn cong thành gì); round the bend (quá tức giận); bend the rules (nới lỏng quy tắc)
phrases, collocations.example: She bent the metal rod into a perfect circle. Waiting in line all day drove me round the bend. Managers sometimes bend the rules to meet deadlines.

phrases, collocations.meaning: make the best of (tận dụng hết khả năng); at your best (ở tình trạng tốt nhất); best of my ability (theo khả năng tốt nhất của tôi); best friend (bạn thân nhất)
phrases, collocations.example: We need to make the best of this opportunity. He performed at his best under pressure. I’ll help you to the best of my ability. She’s been my best friend since college.

phrases, collocations.meaning: bet (sth) on (đánh cuộc thứ gì đó); make a bet (đặt cược); safe bet (điều chắc chắn thành công)
phrases, collocations.example: I’d bet on JavaScript remaining popular for years. He made a bet with his friend about the release date. Opting for thorough tests is a safe bet.

phrases, collocations.meaning: get better (trở nên tốt hơn); better off (khấm khá hơn); better next time (lần sau sẽ tốt hơn); for better or (for worse) (dù tốt dù xấu)
phrases, collocations.example: I hope the system gets better after this update. You’ll be better off using a dedicated database. Maybe we’ll have better luck next time. For better or worse, this is the final design.

phrases, collocations.meaning: make a big thing out of (làm quá/ làm lớn chuyện); make it big (thành công nhanh); big of sb (đã tốt khi làm gì); big on (rất thích); big business (doanh nghiệp lớn); big-hearted (hào hiệp); big name (nhiều tiền); big game (sự kiện quan trọng)
phrases, collocations.example: They made a big thing out of the minor mistake. She hopes to make it big in Silicon Valley. It was big of you to donate so much. He’s really big on open-source software.

phrases, collocations.meaning: block sb’s way (chặn đường của ai); block of flats/apartment block (tòa chung cư); high-rise block (tòa nhà cao tầng); writer’s block (rào cản tâm lý)
phrases, collocations.example: The coach blocked their way onto the field. She lives in a new apartment block downtown. That high-rise block dominates the skyline. He suffered from writer’s block all week.

phrases, collocations.meaning: read sb like a book (hiểu rõ ai); (do) by the book (làm đúng chuẩn); book about/on (cuốn sách về); a closed book (câu đố bí ẩn); open book (người dễ hiểu); in my book (theo tôi); sb’s good/bad books (ai đó hài lòng/khó chịu với)
phrases, collocations.example: I can read you like a book after all these years. She always does things by the book. He recommended a great book on algorithms. His behavior is definitely in my bad books.

phrases, collocations.meaning: born to do (sinh ra để làm); born on/in (sinh vào thời gian/nơi nào); born into (sinh ra trong gia đình); born and bred (sinh ra và lớn lên); born-again (tái sinh, chuyển đạo); newborn (sơ sinh)
phrases, collocations.example: She was born to do complex data analysis. I was born in Hanoi in 1990. He was born into a family of engineers. They are proud of their born-and-bred roots.

phrases, collocations.meaning: come bottom (đứng cuối); get to the bottom of (tìm nguyên nhân); the bottom drops/falls out of (giảm sâu); bottom line (điểm mấu chốt)
phrases, collocations.example: Our team came bottom in the hackathon. We need to get to the bottom of this bug. Suddenly the bottom fell out of the market. The bottom line is that we need more testing.

phrases, collocations.meaning: pick sb’s brain(s) (hỏi để biết thông tin); rack your brain(s) (vắt óc để làm); brains behind (người chịu trách nhiệm); brainless (ngu ngốc); brainstorm (động não); brainwave (cảm hứng đột ngột)
phrases, collocations.example: Can I pick your brains about this architecture? I’ve been racking my brain for hours. She is the brain behind our new feature. We had a productive brainstorm session yesterday.

phrases, collocations.meaning: break a habit (phá vỡ thói quen); break with tradition (phá bỏ truyền thống); take/have/need a break (có thời gian nghỉ); lunch/coffee break (giờ nghỉ trưa/giữa buổi)
phrases, collocations.example: I finally broke my habit of checking email at night. They decided to break with tradition this year. Let’s take a break and grab coffee. We only have a fifteen-minute break left.

phrases, collocations.meaning: bricks and mortar (cửa hàng thực sự); brick wall (bức tường gạch); bricklayer (thợ nề)
phrases, collocations.example: They opened a bricks-and-mortar store downtown. We built a small brick wall in the courtyard. The bricklayer finished the job early.

phrases, collocations.meaning: know/say for certain (biết/chắc chắn); certain to do (chắc chắn làm); make certain (chắc chắn); certain of/about (chắc chắn về); a certain (amount of sth) (một lượng nhất định)
phrases, collocations.example: I can’t say for certain when the release will be. You’re certain to succeed with that plan. Please make certain the tests pass. We need a certain amount of RAM for this VM.

phrases, collocations.meaning: take a chance (đánh liều); leave to chance (mặc kệ); by chance (tình cờ); by any chance (phải vậy không?); second chance (cơ hội thứ hai); last chance (cơ hội cuối cùng); pure chance (ngẫu nhiên thuần túy); there’s every/no chance that (rất có/không có cơ hội)
phrases, collocations.example: I decided to take a chance and rewrite the module. Don’t leave it to chance—write unit tests. We met by chance at the conference. There’s every chance we’ll finish early.

phrases, collocations.meaning: change from sth to sth (đổi từ thứ gì thành); change sth into (biến thứ gì trở thành); change sth for (thay đổi cái gì đó để lấy); change for the better/worse (thay đổi tốt hơn/tệ hơn); change your mind (đổi ý); change the subject (đổi chủ đề); make a change (thay đổi); undergo a change (trải qua thay đổi)
phrases, collocations.example: We need to change from HTTP to HTTPS. He changed his idea into a working prototype. They changed the plan for the better. After reflection, she changed her mind.

phrases, collocations.meaning: charge sb with (buộc tội ai về); charge sb for (đòi tiền ai về); take charge (đảm nhiệm); put sb in charge (trao quyền); overall charge (toàn quyền lãnh đạo)
phrases, collocations.example: They charged her with overseeing the new API. We were charged for extra storage. She took charge of the deployment. The CTO was put in charge of security.

phrases, collocations.meaning: as a child (khi còn nhỏ); only child (con một); child of (con của); childcare (chăm sóc trẻ); child abuse (lạm dụng trẻ em); child’s play (trò chơi trẻ con)
phrases, collocations.example: As a child, I loved playing video games. He was an only child in his family. Childcare services are expanding. That puzzle is child’s play for us.

phrases, collocations.meaning: make a choice (đưa ra lựa chọn); exercise choice (bầu chọn); have no choice (không có lựa chọn nào); choice between (lựa chọn giữa); informed choice (lựa chọn dựa trên thông tin); wide choice (nhiều lựa chọn); obvious choice (lựa chọn hiển nhiên)
phrases, collocations.example: It’s time to make a choice about the framework. Users can exercise choice in their settings. We had no choice but to postpone. There’s a wide choice of libraries available.

phrases, collocations.meaning: choose from (chọn ra từ); choose between (chọn giữa); choose sb/sth as (chọn ai/cái gì làm); choose sb/sth out of (chọn ai/cái gì trong cả nhóm); choose to do (lựa chọn làm gì); pick and choose (cân nhắc kỹ và chọn); nothing to choose between (không có gì để chọn)
phrases, collocations.example: You can choose from several templates. We had to choose between speed and accuracy. They chose her as team lead. There was nothing to choose between the two solutions.

phrases, collocations.meaning: class sb/sth as (phân loại); social class (tầng lớp xã hội); working/middle/upper class (đẳng cấp lao động/trung lưu/thượng lưu); ruling class (giai cấp thống trị); class system (hệ thống giai cấp); class war (mâu thuẫn giai cấp)
phrases, collocations.example: They classed the data points as anomalies. Discussions about social class remain relevant. He grew up in a working-class family. The ruling class resisted the reforms.

phrases, collocations.meaning: give sth a (good) clean (lau dọn sạch sẽ); make a clean break (giải sạch, cắt đứt hoàn toàn); clean and tidy (sạch sẽ gọn gàng); a clean slate (một khởi đầu mới); clean sweep (dọn sạch những thứ không cần thiết)
phrases, collocations.example: Let’s give this codebase a good clean. The team made a clean break from legacy. Keep your workspace clean and tidy. We started with a clean slate after the audit.

phrases, collocations.meaning: make/get sth clear (làm rõ/chứng tỏ); make yourself clear (nói rõ ý của bạn); have a clear conscience (lương tâm trong sạch); clear in your mind (hiểu rõ); clear as a bell (rõ ràng); clear as mud (khó hiểu); clear evidence (bằng chứng); clear case of (trường hợp rõ ràng)
phrases, collocations.example: She made her expectations perfectly clear. He has a clear conscience about the decision. The objective was clear in my mind. That explanation was clear as a bell.

phrases, collocations.meaning: set a clock (đặt báo thức); watch the clock (đếm thời gian); against the clock (chạy đua với thời gian); around the clock (suốt ngày đêm); clockwise (theo chiều kim đồng hồ); clockwork (bộ máy đồng hồ)
phrases, collocations.example: Don’t forget to set the clock before sleeping. We’re racing against the clock to finish. The server runs around the clock. The gears turned like clockwork.

phrases, collocations.meaning: come to a conclusion/decision (đi tới kết luận/quyết định); come to power (lên nắm quyền); come into view (hiện ra trước mắt); come as a shock (gây sốc); come true (trở thành hiện thực)
phrases, collocations.example: We came to a conclusion after reviewing logs. The new party came to power last year. The mountain peak finally came into view. His dream to launch the app came true.

phrases, collocations.meaning: have sth in common (với ai) (có điểm chung); common for sb/sth to do (việc ai đó làm gì là khá phổ biến); common language (ngôn ngữ thường dùng); the common people (người dân); common practice (hành vi phổ biến)
phrases, collocations.example: We have much in common regarding coding standards. It’s common for teams to hold daily stand-ups. English serves as a common language in tech. Code reviews are now common practice.

phrases, collocations.meaning: bring sth to a conclusion (đưa cái gì đến kết luận); come to/reach a conclusion (đi đến kết luận); jump/leap to conclusions (nhảy cóc kết luận); in conclusion (kết lại); foregone conclusion (kết quả đương nhiên)
phrases, collocations.example: Let’s bring this discussion to a conclusion. They reached a conclusion after testing. Don’t jump to conclusions too quickly. In conclusion, we recommend a staging environment.

word formation.meaning: judge(ment), /ˈdʒʌdʒmənt/: sự phán xét. judiciary, /dʒuˈdɪʃəri/: bộ máy tư pháp. judiciousness, /dʒuˈdɪʃəsnəs/: sự sáng suốt. judicious, /dʒuˈdɪʃəs/: khôn ngoan. judicial, /dʒuˈdɪʃl/: (thuộc) tòa án. judge(mental), /ˈdʒʌdʒˌmentl/: mang tính phán xét. judiciously, /dʒuˈdɪʃəsli/: một cách khôn ngoan.
word formation.example: Her judgement was fair. The judiciary needs reform. He acted with judiciousness. It was a judicious move. The judicial process was swift. Don’t be judgmental. He responded judiciously.

word formation.meaning: acknowledge, /əkˈnɒlɪdʒ/: công nhận. acknowledgement, /əkˈnɒlɪdʒmənt/: sự công nhận. knowledge, /ˈnɒlɪdʒ/: tri thức. knowledgeable, /ˈnɒlɪdʒəbl/: uyên bác. (un)acknowledged, /(ˌʌn)əkˈnɒlɪdʒd/: (không) được công nhận. knowing(ly), /ˈnəʊɪŋ(li)/: (một cách) thận trọng, hiểu biết.
word formation.example: He acknowledged his mistake. They gave no acknowledgement. She has vast knowledge. He is very knowledgeable. Her help was unacknowledged. He smiled knowingly.

word formation.meaning: landing, /ˈlændɪŋ/: việc đổ bộ, hạ cánh. landed, /ˈlændɪd/: đã có đất đai. landless, /ˈlændləs/: không có đất. (re)land, /ˈlænd/: (hạ) cánh.
word formation.example: The landing was smooth. They are landed gentry. The landless farmers protested. We will land soon.

word formation.meaning: enlarge, /ɪnˈlɑːdʒ/: mở rộng. enlargement, /ɪnˈlɑːdʒmənt/: sự mở rộng. largely, /ˈlɑːdʒli/: phần lớn.
word formation.example: We plan to enlarge the facility. The enlargement will take weeks. It was largely successful.

word formation.meaning: outlast, /ˌaʊtˈlɑːst/: tồn tại lâu hơn. lasting, /ˈlɑːstɪŋ/: bền vững. everlasting, /ˌevəˈlɑːstɪŋ/: vĩnh viễn. lastly, /ˈlɑːstli/: cuối cùng thì.
word formation.example: He outlasted all rivals. The impact was lasting. Their love is everlasting. Lastly, I want to thank you.

word formation.meaning: leisure, /ˈleʒə(r)/: nhàn hạ. leisurely, /ˈleʒəli/: một cách chậm rãi.
word formation.example: She enjoys leisure time. They walked leisurely by the beach.

word formation.meaning: (il)logical(ly), /(ɪ)ˈlɒdʒɪkl(i)/: (một cách) (không) hợp lý.
word formation.example: His argument is logical. She reacted illogically.

word formation.meaning: prolong, /prəˈlɒŋ/: kéo dài. lengthen, /ˈleŋθn/: kéo dài. long, /lɒŋ/: dài. longevity, /lɒnˈdʒevəti/: sự trường thọ. longhand, /ˈlɒŋhænd/: chữ viết tay. longing(ly), /ˈlɒŋɪŋ(li)/: (một cách) khát khao. lengthy, /ˈleŋkθi/: dài dòng. prolonged, /prəˈlɒŋd/: kéo dài thêm. lengthways, /ˈleŋkθweɪz/: theo chiều dọc. lengthwise, /ˈleŋkθwaɪz/: theo chiều dọc.
word formation.example: Stress may prolong illness. She tried to lengthen the rope. They lived a long life. His longevity is impressive. She wrote it in longhand. He looked at her longingly. It was a lengthy discussion. The meeting was prolonged. Cut the wood lengthways. Fold it lengthwise.

word formation.meaning: allot, /əˈlɒt/: phân công. allotment, /əˈlɒtmənt/: sự phân công.
word formation.example: The manager will allot tasks. Each team received their allotment.

word formation.meaning: (dis)loyalty, /(dɪs)ˈlɔɪəlti/: (không) trung thành. (dis)loyal(ly), /(dɪs)ˈlɔɪəli/: (một cách) (không) trung thành.
word formation.example: His loyalty was admirable. She acted disloyally.

word formation.meaning: magnificence, /mæɡˈnɪfɪsns/: sự nguy nga. magnification, /ˌmæɡnɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/: sự phóng đại. magnificent(ly), /mæɡˈnɪfɪsnt(li)/: (một cách) tráng lệ.
word formation.example: The palace was a scene of magnificence. Use 10x magnification. She was magnificently dressed.

word formation.meaning: majorette, /ˌmeɪdʒəˈret/: nữ đội trưởng diễu hành.
word formation.example: The majorette led the parade confidently.

word formation.meaning: mismanage, /ˌmɪsˈmænɪdʒ/: quản lý kém. management, /ˈmænɪdʒmənt/: quản lý. manager, /ˈmænɪdʒə(r)/: người quản lý. (mis)management, /(ˌmɪs)ˈmænɪdʒmənt/: (sự) (kém) quản lý. (un)manageable, /ˌʌnˈmænɪdʒəbl/: (không) có thể quản lý. mismanaged, /ˌmɪsˈmænɪdʒd/: bị quản lý kém. managerial(ly), /ˌmænəˈdʒɪəriəli/: (thuộc) quản lý.
word formation.example: He mismanaged the project. She works in management. The manager arrived late. Poor management hurt the company. The problem is unmanageable. The funds were mismanaged. She has strong managerial skills.

word formation.meaning: manufacturer, /ˌmænjuˈfæktʃərə(r)/: nhà sản xuất. manufacturing, /ˌmænjuˈfæktʃərɪŋ/: sự sản xuất.
word formation.example: The manufacturer recalled the product. Manufacturing costs rose.

word formation.meaning: matchmaker, /ˈmætʃmeɪkə(r)/: bà mối. matchmaking, /ˈmætʃmeɪkɪŋ/: công việc mối lái. matchstick, /ˈmætʃstɪk/: que diêm. matchwood, /ˈmætʃwʊd/: gỗ diêm. matchbook, /ˈmætʃbʊk/: hộp diêm. matchless, /ˈmætʃləs/: vô song. matching, /ˈmætʃɪŋ/: hợp. unmatched, /ʌnˈmætʃt/: lệch, không sánh bằng.
word formation.example: She worked as a matchmaker. Matchmaking takes skill. He struck a matchstick. The desk was reduced to matchwood. The matchbook was empty. Her beauty is matchless. They wore matching outfits. His talent is unmatched.

word formation.meaning: materialise, /məˈtɪəriəlaɪz/: cụ thể hóa. materialism, /məˈtɪəriəlɪzəm/: chủ nghĩa duy vật. materialistic, /məˌtɪəriəˈlɪstɪk/: nặng về vật chất. immaterial, /ˌɪməˈtɪəriəl/: không quan trọng. materially, /məˈtɪəriəli/: một cách hữu hình.
word formation.example: His ideas failed to materialise. He rejects materialism. She’s materialistic. That fact is immaterial. He was materially supported.

word formation.meaning: (im)maturity, /(ˌɪ)məˈtjʊərəti/: (sự) (thiếu) trưởng thành. maturation, /ˌmætʃuˈreɪʃn/: sự chín, trưởng thành. immature, /ˌɪməˈtjʊə(r)/: non nớt.
word formation.example: He showed maturity beyond his years. The maturation process takes time. His behavior was immature.

word formation.meaning: meaning, /ˈmiːnɪŋ/: ý nghĩa. meaningfulness, /ˈmiːnɪŋflnəs/: sự có ý nghĩa. meaningless, /ˈmiːnɪŋləs/: vô nghĩa. meaningful(ly), /ˈmiːnɪŋfl(i)/: (một cách) có ý nghĩa.
word formation.example: The meaning is unclear. She questioned the meaningfulness of the ritual. The phrase is meaningless. He nodded meaningfully.

word formation.meaning: metallic, /məˈtælɪk/: (thuộc) kim loại. metallurgy, /məˈtælədʒi/: ngành luyện kim.
word formation.example: The sculpture had a metallic finish. He studied metallurgy in college.

word formation.meaning: mighty, /ˈmaɪti/: mạnh, hùng cường. mightily, /ˈmaɪtəli/: một cách đầy quyền lực.
word formation.example: He gave a mighty roar. She tried mightily to finish on time.

word formation.meaning: minority, /maɪˈnɒrəti/: thiểu số.
word formation.example: The ethnic minority lives in the mountains.

word formation.meaning: (im)mobilise, /(ˌɪ)məʊbəlaɪz/: huy động, huy động. (im)mobility, /(ˌɪ)məʊˈbɪləti/: (sự) (không) chuyển động. mobilisation, /ˌməʊbəlaɪˈzeɪʃn/: sự huy động. immobile, /ɪˈməʊbaɪl/: bất động.
word formation.example: The army was mobilised quickly. Economic mobility is important. Mobilisation began at dawn. He remained immobile during treatment.

word formation.meaning: modernise, /ˈmɒdənaɪz/: hiện đại hóa. modernisation, /ˌmɒdənaɪˈzeɪʃn/: sự hiện đại hóa. modernism, /ˈmɒdənɪzəm/: chủ nghĩa hiện đại. modernist, /ˈmɒdənɪst/: người theo chủ nghĩa hiện đại.
word formation.example: We plan to modernise the building. Modernisation takes time. Modernism influenced design. He’s a modernist architect.

word formation.meaning: modality, /məʊˈdæləti/: trình hiện đại.
word formation.example: Different learning modalities exist.

word formation.meaning: momentary, /ˈməʊməntri/: chốc lát. momentarily, /ˌməʊmənˈterəli/: ngay tức khắc.
word formation.example: There was a momentary silence. She paused momentarily.

word formation.meaning: moralise, /ˈmɒrəlaɪz/: lên lớp dạy đời. demoralise, /dɪˈmɒrəlaɪz/: làm mất tinh thần. (im/a)morality, /(ɪ)məˈræləti/: (trái) đạo đức. moralist, /ˈmɒrəlɪst/: nhà đạo đức học. morale, /məˈrɑːl/: nhuệ khí. (im/a)moral(ly), /(ɪ)mˈɒrəli/: (không) phù hợp đạo đức.
word formation.example: Stop trying to moralise everything. War can demoralise soldiers. Immorality is punished. He’s a moralist. Troop morale was low. It was morally wrong.

word formation.meaning: motionless, /ˈməʊʃnləs/: bất động.
word formation.example: She stood motionless with fear.

word formation.meaning: (de)motivate, /(ˌdiː)ˈməʊtɪveɪt/: (tước bỏ) thúc đẩy. motivator, /ˈməʊtɪveɪtə(r)/: yếu tố thúc đẩy. (de)motivation, /(ˌdiː)ˌməʊtɪˈveɪʃn/: (sự) (thiếu) động lực. (de)motivating, /(ˌdiː)ˈməʊtɪveɪtɪŋ/: (có tính) (tước bỏ) động lực. motivational, /ˌməʊtɪˈveɪʃənl/: có sức truyền cảm hứng.
word formation.example: Praise can motivate students. Lack of pay demotivates workers. A good teacher is a motivator. Demotivation spread through the team. Her speech was motivational.

word formation.meaning: surmount, /səˈmaʊnt/: vượt qua. mountain, /ˈmaʊntən/: núi. mountaineering, /ˌmaʊntəˈnɪərɪŋ/: môn leo núi. (in)surmountable, /(ɪn)səˈmaʊntəbl/: (không) thể khắc phục được. mountainous, /ˈmaʊntənəs/: (thuộc) vùng núi.
word formation.example: They tried to surmount the obstacles. We hiked up the mountain. Mountaineering requires training. The problem is insurmountable. It’s a mountainous region.

word formation.meaning: mover, /ˈmuːvə(r)/: động cơ, lực. movement, /ˈmuːvmənt/: sự chuyển động. (im)movable, /(ˌɪ)ˈmuːvəbl/: (không) có thể di chuyển.
word formation.example: He is a fast mover. The movement was quick. This box is immovable.

word formation.meaning: mystify, /ˈmɪstɪfaɪ/: làm hoang mang. mystification, /ˌmɪstɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/: tình trạng bối rối. mysterious(ly), /mɪˈstɪəriəs(li)/: (một cách) bí ẩn.
word formation.example: The instructions mystify me. His disappearance caused mystification. She smiled mysteriously.

word formation.meaning: negligence, /ˈneɡlɪdʒəns/: tính cẩu thả. negligible, /ˈneɡlɪdʒəbl/: không đáng kể. neglectful(ly), /nɪˈɡlektfl(i)/: (một cách) tắc trách.
word formation.example: His negligence led to an accident. The effect is negligible. He behaved neglectfully.

word formation.meaning: renew, /rɪˈnjuː/: làm mới lại. renewal, /rɪˈnjuːəl/: sự làm mới lại. newness, /ˈnjuːnəs/: tính mới mẻ. renewable, /rɪˈnjuːəbl/: có thể đổi mới. anew, /əˈnjuː/: lại, một lần nữa.
word formation.example: They renewed their vows. The building needs renewal. He enjoyed the newness of the place. It’s a renewable contract. Let’s try anew.

word formation.meaning: historian, /hɪˈstɔːriən/: nhà sử học. historic, /hɪˈstɒrɪk/: mang tính lịch sử. historical(ly), /hɪˈstɒrɪkl(i)/: (một cách) thuộc lịch sử.
word formation.example: The historian gave a lecture. It was a historic event. Historically, this site is significant.

word formation.meaning: housing, /ˈhaʊzɪŋ/: nhà ở. household(er), /ˈhaʊshəʊld(ə)/: hộ gia đình. houseful, /ˈhaʊsfʊl/: đầy một nhà.
word formation.example: Affordable housing is a concern. The householder paid taxes. We had a houseful of guests.

word formation.meaning: humanise, /ˈhjuːmənaɪz/: nhân hóa. humanity, /hjuːˈmænəti/: nhân loại. humanism, /ˈhjuːmənɪzəm/: chủ nghĩa nhân đạo. humanist, /ˈhjuːmənɪst/: người theo chủ nghĩa nhân đạo. humanities, /hjuːˈmænətiz/: các môn nhân văn. humanitarian, /hjuːˌmænɪˈteəriən/: người theo chủ nghĩa nhân đạo. humane, /hjuːˈmeɪn/: nhân văn. humanly, /ˈhjuːmənli/: từ góc độ con người.
word formation.example: They tried to humanise the system. We must protect humanity. She promotes humanism. He’s a humanist. She teaches the humanities. The humanitarian helped refugees. It’s the humane thing to do. Humanly speaking, it’s impossible.

word formation.meaning: idealise, /aɪˈdɪəlaɪz/: lý tưởng hóa. idealism, /ˈaɪdiəlɪzəm/: chủ nghĩa lý tưởng. idealisation, /ˌaɪdɪələˈzeɪʃn/: sự lý tưởng hóa. idealist, /ˈaɪdiəlɪst/: người theo chủ nghĩa lý tưởng. idealistic, /ˌaɪdiəˈlɪstɪk/: duy tâm. idealised, /ˈaɪdiəlaɪzd/: được lý tưởng hóa. ideally, /aɪˈdɪəli/: một cách lý tưởng.
word formation.example: He tends to idealise relationships. She believes in idealism. Their idealisation of youth is common. He’s a romantic idealist. That view is idealistic. The story is idealised. Ideally, we should leave at noon.

word formation.meaning: disillusion, /ˌdɪsɪˈluːʒn/: sự vỡ mộng. disillusionment, /ˌdɪsɪˈluːʒnmənt/: sự làm vỡ mộng. disillusioned, /ˌdɪsɪˈluːʒnd/: bị vỡ mộng. illusory, /ɪˈluːsəri/: ảo tưởng, viển vông.
word formation.example: He felt disillusioned by politics. Disillusionment followed quickly. She became disillusioned. Their hopes proved illusory.

word formation.meaning: imagination, /ɪˌmædʒɪˈneɪʃn/: trí tưởng tượng. imaginings, /ɪˈmædʒɪnɪŋz/: những hình dung. imaginative(ly), /ɪˈmædʒɪnətɪv(li)/: (một cách) giàu trí tưởng tượng. (un)imaginative(ly), /(ʌn)ɪˈmædʒɪnətɪv(li)/: (một cách) (không) giàu trí tưởng tượng.
word formation.example: Children have great imagination. Her imaginings were vivid. He’s very imaginative. The design was unimaginatively done.

word formation.meaning: imitation, /ˌɪmɪˈteɪʃn/: sự bắt chước. imitator, /ˈɪmɪteɪtə(r)/: kẻ bắt chước. imitative, /ˈɪmɪtətɪv/: giả, có tính bắt chước. inimitable, /ɪˈnɪmɪtəbl/: không thể bắt chước được.
word formation.example: That was only an imitation. He is a clever imitator. Her style is imitative. His performance is inimitable.

word formation.meaning: implicate, /ˈɪmplɪkeɪt/: lôi kéo, dính líu. implication, /ˌɪmplɪˈkeɪʃn/: sự liên can. implicit(ly), /ɪmˈplɪsɪt(li)/: (một cách) ngầm định.
word formation.example: He was implicated in the crime. The implication is serious. She trusted him implicitly.

word formation.meaning: impression, /ɪmˈpreʃn/: ấn tượng. (un)impressiveness, /(ʌn)ɪmˈpresɪvnəs/: sự (không) ấn tượng. impressionist, /ɪmˈpreʃənɪst/: người theo trường phái ấn tượng. impressionable, /ɪmˈpreʃənəbl/: dễ bị ảnh hưởng. impressionistic, /ˌɪmpreʃəˈnɪstɪk/: thuộc trường phái ấn tượng. (un)impressive(ly), /(ʌn)ɪmˈpresɪvli/: (một cách) (không) gây ấn tượng.
word formation.example: He made a strong impression. The show lacked impressiveness. She is an impressionist painter. Teens are often impressionable. The painting was impressionistic. He performed impressively.

word formation.meaning: improvement, /ɪmˈpruːvmənt/: sự cải thiện. improvable, /ɪmˈpruːvəbl/: có thể cải thiện. improved, /ɪmˈpruːvd/: được cải thiện.
word formation.example: There’s been great improvement. The system is improvable. His skills have improved.

word formation.meaning: incidence, /ˈɪnsɪdəns/: tần suất, tỉ lệ mắc phải.
word formation.example: The incidence of flu increases in winter.

word formation.meaning: coincidence, /kəʊˈɪnsɪdəns/: sự trùng hợp. coincidental(ly), /kəʊˌɪnsɪˈdentl(i)/: (một cách) ngẫu nhiên.
word formation.example: It was pure coincidence. They met coincidentally at the airport.

word formation.meaning: indication, /ˌɪndɪˈkeɪʃn/: sự biểu thị. indicator, /ˈɪndɪkeɪtə(r)/: tín hiệu. indicative, /ɪnˈdɪkətɪv/: chỉ ra.
word formation.example: There’s no clear indication of fraud. The fuel gauge is an indicator. The results are indicative of progress.

word formation.meaning: individualise, /ˌɪndɪˈvɪdʒuəlaɪz/: cá nhân hóa. individualism, /ɪnˈdɪvɪdʒuəlɪzəm/: chủ nghĩa cá nhân. individuality, /ˌɪndɪˌvɪdʒuˈæləti/: cá tính. individualist, /ɪnˈdɪvɪdʒuəlɪst/: người theo chủ nghĩa cá nhân. individualistic, /ˌɪndɪˌvɪdʒuəˈlɪstɪk/: mang tính cá nhân.
word formation.example: The teacher individualises lessons. She supports individualism. His individuality stood out. He is an individualist. She has an individualistic style.

word formation.meaning: influential, /ˌɪnfluˈenʃl/: có ảnh hưởng lớn.
word formation.example: He is an influential speaker.

word formation.meaning: inhabitant, /ɪnˈhæbɪtənt/: cư dân. habitat, /ˈhæbɪtæt/: môi trường sống. habitation, /ˌhæbɪˈteɪʃn/: nơi ở. (un)inhabitable, /ʌnˈhæbɪtəbl/: (không) thể ở được.
word formation.example: The city has millions of inhabitants. This area is a natural habitat. The building is uninhabitable.

word formation.meaning: inheritance, /ɪnˈherɪtəns/: sự thừa kế. heritage, /ˈherɪtɪdʒ/: di sản. hereditary, /həˈredɪtəri/: truyền từ đời này sang đời khác.
word formation.example: She received a large inheritance. The temple is part of cultural heritage. It’s a hereditary disease.

word formation.meaning: insistence, /ɪnˈsɪstəns/: sự khăng khăng. insistent, /ɪnˈsɪstənt/: khăng khăng.
word formation.example: Her insistence on details was exhausting. He was very insistent.

word formation.meaning: instinctive(ly), /ɪnˈstɪŋktɪv(li)/: (một cách) theo bản năng.
word formation.example: She responded instinctively to danger.

word formation.meaning: institutionalise, /ˌɪnstɪˈtjuːʃənəlaɪz/: thể chế hóa. institution, /ˌɪnstɪˈtjuːʃn/: tổ chức. institutional, /ˌɪnstɪˈtjuːʃənl/: thuộc tổ chức. institutionalised, /ˌɪnstɪˈtjuːʃnəlaɪzd/: được thể chế hóa.
word formation.example: They want to institutionalise the reform. She works at a large institution. It’s an institutional decision. That practice is now institutionalised.

word formation.meaning: intention, /ɪnˈtenʃn/: ý định. (un)intended, /(ʌn)ɪnˈtendɪd/: (không) cố ý. (un)intentional(ly), /(ʌn)ɪnˈtenʃən(ə)li/: (một cách) (không) có chủ đích.
word formation.example: His intention was clear. It was an unintended consequence. She acted intentionally.

word formation.meaning: intimacy, /ˈɪntɪməsi/: sự thân mật. intimately, /ˈɪntɪmətli/: một cách thân mật.
word formation.example: There was an intimacy between them. They spoke intimately.

word formation.meaning: jobbing, /ˈdʒɒbɪŋ/: làm việc vặt. jobless, /ˈdʒɒbləs/: thất nghiệp.
word formation.example: He found jobbing work easily. Many people are jobless this year.

word formation.meaning: electrify, /ɪˈlektrɪfaɪ/: làm nhiễm điện. electrician, /ɪˌlekˈtrɪʃn/: thợ điện. electricity, /ɪˌlekˈtrɪsəti/: điện. electrified, /ɪˈlektrɪfaɪd/: đã nhiễm điện. electrifying, /ɪˈlektrɪfaɪɪŋ/: nhiễm điện. electrical(ly), /ɪˈlektrɪkl(i)/: (về) điện.
word formation.example: The wires were electrified. Call an electrician for this job. Electricity went out. The crowd was electrified by the speech. It was an electrifying moment. That’s an electrical failure.

word formation.meaning: elusiveness, /ɪˈluːsɪvnəs/: tính lảng tránh. elusive(ly), /ɪˈluːsɪv(li)/: một cách khó nắm bắt.
word formation.example: The criminal’s elusiveness frustrated the police. She smiled elusively.

word formation.meaning: (un)employment, /(ˌʌn)ɪmˈplɔɪmənt/: (tình trạng) thất nghiệp. underemployment, /ˌʌndərɪmˈplɔɪmənt/: tình trạng thiếu việc. employer, /ɪmˈplɔɪə(r)/: người sử dụng lao động. employee, /ˌemplɔɪˈiː/: người lao động. (un)employed, /(ʌn)ɪmˈplɔɪd/: (không) có việc. unemployed, /ˌʌnɪmˈplɔɪd/: thất nghiệp. (un)employable, /(ˌʌn)ɪmˈplɔɪəbl/: (không) có thể tuyển dụng.
word formation.example: Unemployment rose last year. Many face underemployment. The employer posted a new job. The employee was promoted. He is currently unemployed. They are unemployable.

word formation.meaning: endure, /ɪnˈdjʊə(r)/: chịu đựng. endurance, /ɪnˈdjʊərəns/: sức bền. (un)endurable, /(ʌn)ɪnˈdjʊərəbl/: (không) chịu đựng được. unending, /ʌnˈendɪŋ/: lâu dài. ending, /ˈendɪŋ/: sự kết thúc. endless(ly), /ˈendləs(li)/: (một cách) bất tận.
word formation.example: She had to endure pain. His endurance is impressive. The noise was unendurable. They faced unending challenges. The ending was sad. The rain fell endlessly.

word formation.meaning: (un)enviable, /(ʌn)ˈenviəbl/: (không) đáng ghen tị. (un)enviably, /(ʌn)ˈenviəbli/: (một cách) (không) đáng ghen tị. envious(ly), /ˈenviəs(li)/: (một cách) ghen tị.
word formation.example: She has an enviable position. It’s enviably close to the beach. He looked at me enviously.

word formation.meaning: erosion, /ɪˈrəʊʒn/: sự xói mòn.
word formation.example: Soil erosion is a serious problem.

word formation.meaning: eruption, /ɪˈrʌpʃn/: sự phun trào.
word formation.example: The volcano's eruption was massive.

word formation.meaning: eventuality, /ɪˌventʃuˈæləti/: tình huống có thể xảy ra. (un)eventful, /(ʌn)ɪˈventfl/: (không) có nhiều sự kiện. eventual(ly), /ɪˈventʃuəli/: rốt cuộc.
word formation.example: We prepared for every eventuality. It was an uneventful trip. Eventually, she succeeded.

word formation.meaning: evolution, /ˌiːvəˈluːʃn/: sự tiến hóa. evolutionary, /ˌiːvəˈluːʃənəri/: thuộc tiến hóa. evolving, /ɪˈvɒlvɪŋ/: đang tiến hóa.
word formation.example: Evolution is a natural process. This is an evolutionary step. Language is constantly evolving.

word formation.meaning: exemplify, /ɪɡˈzemplɪfaɪ/: minh họa. exemplification, /ɪɡˌzemplɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/: sự minh họa. exemplary, /ɪɡˈzempləri/: mẫu mực.
word formation.example: She exemplifies dedication. His action is an exemplification. He received an award for exemplary conduct.

word formation.meaning: exclamation, /ˌekskləˈmeɪʃn/: câu cảm thán. exclamatory, /eksˈklæmətri/: có tính cảm thán.
word formation.example: He let out an exclamation. She gave an exclamatory shout.

word formation.meaning: expectation, /ˌekspekˈteɪʃn/: sự mong đợi. expectancy, /ɪkˈspektənsi/: (một cách) đầy mong đợi. expectant(ly), /ɪkˈspektənt(li)/: (một cách) mong chờ. (un)expected(ly), /(ʌn)ɪkˈspektɪd(li)/: (một cách) (không) ngờ tới.
word formation.example: The results met our expectations. The atmosphere was full of expectancy. She looked at me expectantly. The call came unexpectedly.

word formation.meaning: explanation, /ˌekspləˈneɪʃn/: sự giải thích. explanatory, /ɪkˈsplænətri/: mang tính giải thích. unexplained, /ˌʌnɪkˈspleɪnd/: không rõ nguyên nhân. (in)explicable, /(ɪn)ˈeksplɪkəbl/: (không) thể giải thích được. inexplicably, /ˌɪnɪkˈsplɪkəbli/: một cách không thể giải thích được.
word formation.example: She gave a clear explanation. Read the explanatory notes. The illness remains unexplained. His reaction was inexplicable. She left inexplicably.

word formation.meaning: expression, /ɪkˈspreʃn/: sự biểu lộ. expressiveness, /ɪkˈspreʃɪvnəs/: tính diễn cảm. expressionism, /ɪkˈspreʃənɪzəm/: chủ nghĩa biểu hiện. expressionist, /ɪkˈspreʃənɪst/: người theo chủ nghĩa biểu hiện. expressive(ly), /ɪkˈspresɪv(li)/: (một cách) biểu cảm. expressionless(ness), /ɪkˈspreʃnləs(nəs)/: (một cách) vô cảm.
word formation.example: Her expression changed suddenly. His eyes were full of expressiveness. She studied expressionism. He’s an expressionist painter. He smiled expressively. His face remained expressionless.

word formation.meaning: extension, /ɪkˈstenʃn/: sự mở rộng. extent, /ɪkˈstent/: mức độ. (un)extended, /(ʌn)ɪkˈstendɪd/: (không) được mở rộng. (in)extensible, /(ɪn)ɪkˈstensəbl/: (không) có thể bao quát.
word formation.example: They built an extension to the house. To a large extent, I agree. It’s an extended warranty. The rope is inextensible.

word formation.meaning: extinction, /ɪkˈstɪŋkʃn/: sự tuyệt chủng.
word formation.example: Many species face extinction.

word formation.meaning: familiarise, /fəˈmɪliəraɪz/: làm cho quen thuộc. (un)familiarity, /(ʌn)fəˌmɪliˈærəti/: (sự) (không) quen thuộc. unfamiliar, /ˌʌnfəˈmɪliə(r)/: không quen thuộc. familiarly, /fəˈmɪliəli/: một cách thân thuộc.
word formation.example: You should familiarise yourself with the rules. His unfamiliarity was obvious. This is unfamiliar territory. She spoke familiarly.

word formation.meaning: favouritism, /ˈfeɪvərɪtɪzəm/: sự thiên vị. favourite, /ˈfeɪvərɪt/: yêu thích. (un)favourable, /(ʌn)ˈfeɪvərəbl/: (không) có thiện chí. (un)favourably, /(ʌn)ˈfeɪvərəbli/: (một cách) (không) thuận lợi.
word formation.example: He was accused of favouritism. She is my favourite teacher. The outcome was favourable. They were unfavourably compared.

word formation.meaning: infinity, /ɪnˈfɪnəti/: vô cực. infinitive, /ɪnˈfɪnətɪv/: nguyên thể. infinite(ly), /ˈɪnfɪnət(li)/: (một cách) vô hạn. infinitesimal(ly), /ˌɪnfɪnɪˈtesɪml(i)/: (một cách) vi phân.
word formation.example: The universe is not infinite. Infinity is a complex idea. Use the infinitive form. Infinitely more efficient. The difference was infinitesimal.

word formation.meaning: (in)flexibility, /(ɪn)ˌfleksəˈbɪləti/: (tính) (không) linh hoạt. inflexible, /ɪnˈfleksəbl/: cứng nhắc.
word formation.example: Flexibility is key in this job. The plan was inflexible.

word formation.meaning: characterise, /ˈkærəktəraɪz/: mô tả như là. characterisation, /ˌkærəktəraɪˈzeɪʃn/: sự mô tả như là. (un)characteristic, /(ʌn)ˌkærəktəˈrɪstɪk/: (không) đặc trưng. characterless, /ˈkærəktələs/: không có bản sắc.
word formation.example: The author characterises him as a hero. Her characterisation was accurate. That behavior is uncharacteristic. The new building feels characterless.

word formation.meaning: charitableness, /ˈtʃærətəblnəs/: lòng nhân ái. (un)charitable(ly), /(ʌn)ˈtʃærətəbl(i)/: (không) khoan dung.
word formation.example: Her charitableness touched many lives. He spoke uncharitably in anger.

word formation.meaning: chose, /tʃəʊz/: quá khứ choose. chosen, /ˈtʃəʊzn/: được chọn. choice, /tʃɔɪs/: sự lựa chọn. choosy, /ˈtʃuːzi/: kén chọn.
word formation.example: He chose wisely. She is the chosen candidate. You have a choice. She’s very choosy about clothes.

word formation.meaning: outclass, /ˌaʊtˈklɑːs/: vượt trội. (de)classify, /ˈklæsɪfaɪ/: phân loại. classics, /ˈklæsɪks/: văn học Hy Lạp cổ. classifieds, /ˈklæsɪfaɪdz/: mục rao vặt. classification, /ˌklæsɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/: sự phân loại. classlessness, /ˈklɑːsləsnəs/: không giai cấp. classmate, /ˈklɑːsmeɪt/: bạn cùng lớp. classroom, /ˈklɑːsruːm/: phòng học. classwork, /ˈklɑːswɜːk/: bài học trên lớp. classy, /ˈklɑːsi/: ưu tú.
word formation.example: She outclassed all the runners. They classified the documents. I love reading the classics. He searched the classifieds. We studied animal classification. The movement promoted classlessness. My classmate is helpful. The classroom was quiet. His classwork is excellent. That's a classy dress.

word formation.meaning: collect(v), /kəˈlekt/: thu thập. collector, /kəˈlektə(r)/: người sưu tầm. collection, /kəˈlekʃn/: bộ sưu tập. collectable, /kəˈlektəbl/: có thể thu thập được. collected, /kəˈlektɪd/: được thu thập. collective(ly), /kəˈlektɪv(li)/: (một cách) tập thể.
word formation.example: He collects stamps. The art collector visited. This is a rare collection. These items are collectable. All data was collected. We acted collectively.

word formation.meaning: overcome, /ˌəʊvəˈkʌm/: vượt qua. comeback, /ˈkʌmbæk/: sự trở lại. newcomer, /ˈnjuːˌkʌmə(r)/: người mới. outcome, /ˈaʊtkʌm/: kết quả. income, /ˈɪnkʌm/: thu nhập. coming, /ˈkʌmɪŋ/: sắp tới. oncoming, /ˈɒnkʌmɪŋ/: đang đến gần. incoming, /ˈɪnkʌmɪŋ/: mới đến.
word formation.example: He overcame great odds. The singer made a comeback. The newcomer was nervous. The outcome was expected. My income has increased. The coming days are busy. An oncoming car appeared. The incoming mail was sorted.

word formation.meaning: competition, /ˌkɒmpəˈtɪʃn/: cuộc thi. competitor, /kəmˈpetɪtə(r)/: đối thủ. competitiveness, /kəmˈpetətɪvnəs/: tính cạnh tranh. (un)competitive(ly), /(ʌn)kəmˈpetətɪv(li)/: (một cách) (không) cạnh tranh.
word formation.example: The competition was fierce. He’s a strong competitor. They promote competitiveness. She priced it competitively. It’s uncompetitively expensive.

word formation.meaning: conceptualise, /kənˈseptʃuəlaɪz/: khái niệm hóa. concept, /ˈkɒnsept/: khái niệm. conception, /kənˈsepʃn/: quan niệm. (in)conceivable, /(ɪn)kənˈsiːvəbl/: (không) có thể tưởng tượng. (in)conceivably, /(ɪn)kənˈsiːvəbli/: (một cách) (không) tưởng tượng được.

word formation.meaning: disconnect, /ˌdɪskəˈnekt/: ngắt kết nối. reconnect, /ˌriːkəˈnekt/: kết nối lại. interconnect, /ˌɪntəkəˈnekt/: kết nối lẫn nhau. interconnection, /ˌɪntəkəˈnekʃn/: sự liên kết. word formation.meaning: (de)sensitise, /ˈdesəntaɪz/: làm (mất) nhạy cảm. (in)sensitivity, /ˌɪnsensəˈtɪvəti/: (thiếu) nhạy cảm. hypersensitivity, /ˌhaɪpəsensəˈtɪvəti/: sự quá nhạy cảm. sensibility, /ˌsensəˈbɪləti/: trí giác, sự nhạy cảm. sense(less)(ness), /ˈsensləs(nəs)/: (sự) bất tỉnh, vô nghĩa. sensuality, /ˌsenʃuˈæləti/: ham muốn nhục dục. sensuousness, /ˈsenʃuəsnəs/: ham muốn nhục dục. sensor, /ˈsensər/: cảm biến. hypersensitive, /ˌhaɪpəˈsensətɪv/: quá nhạy cảm. oversensitive, /ˌəʊvəsensətɪv/: quá nhạy cảm. nonsense, /ˈnɒnsens/: vô nghĩa. sensory, /ˈsensəri/: (thuộc) cảm giác, xúc giác.
word formation.example: The drug desensitised his pain. Her insensitivity upset him. He suffers from hypersensitivity. Her sensibility makes her a great artist. The joke was senseless. His sensuality was obvious. The poem had deep sensuousness. The sensor detected movement. She’s hypersensitive to criticism. Don’t be oversensitive. That’s complete nonsense. The painting evoked a strong sensory response.

(in)sensational(ly), /(ɪn)senˈseɪʃənl(i)/: (một cách) (không) gây xúc động. sensual(ly), /ˈsenʃuəl(i)/: (một cách) nhục dục. sensuous(ly), /ˈsenʃuəsli/: (một cách) đầy kích thích giác quan.

word formation.meaning: spacing, /ˈspeɪsɪŋ/: sự giãn cách. spaciousness, /ˈspeɪʃəsnəs/: tính rộng rãi. spacious(ly), /ˈspeɪʃəsli/: (một cách) rộng rãi.

word formation.meaning: spoke, /spəʊk/: nói (quá khứ). speech, /spiːtʃ/: bài diễn văn. speaker, /ˈspiːkər/: người nói. spokesmen, /ˈspəʊksmən/: phát ngôn viên (nam). spokeswoman, /ˈspəʊkswʊmən/: phát ngôn viên (nữ). spokeswomen, /ˈspəʊkswɪmɪn/: phát ngôn viên (nữ, số nhiều). spokesperson, /ˈspəʊkspɜːsn/: người phát ngôn.
word formation.example: He spoke at the event. Her speech was inspiring. The speaker took questions. The company’s spokesman issued a statement. The spokeswoman denied the claims. Two spokeswomen were present. The spokesperson addressed the press.

word formation.meaning: spokespeople, /ˈspəʊksˌpiːpl/: những phát ngôn viên. outspokenness, /ˌaʊtˈspəʊkənnəs/: thẳng thắn. (un)spoken, /ˌʌnˈspəʊkən/: (không) được nói ra. speechless, /ˈspiːtʃləs/: cạn lời. unspeakable, /ʌnˈspiːkəbl/: không thể diễn tả. unspeakably, /ʌnˈspiːkəbli/: cực kỳ. outspoken(ly), /ˌaʊtˈspəʊkən(li)/: (một cách) thẳng thắn.
word formation.example: The spokespeople met the press. His outspokenness was admirable. The pain was unspoken. She was speechless with joy. That crime was unspeakable. He was unspeakably rude. She criticized them outspokenly.

word formation.meaning: sped, /sped/: sự chạy tốc độ. speeding, /ˈspiːdɪŋ/: lái xe quá tốc độ. speedy, /ˈspiːdi/: nhanh chóng. speedily, /ˈspiːdɪli/: một cách nhanh chóng.
word formation.example: He sped down the highway. She was fined for speeding. We need a speedy solution. The issue was resolved speedily.

word formation.meaning: sportsman, /ˈspɔːtsmən/: vận động viên (nam). sportswoman, /ˈspɔːtsˌwʊmən/: vận động viên (nữ). sportsperson, /ˈspɔːtspɜːsn/: vận động viên. sportsmanship, /ˈspɔːtsmənʃɪp/: tinh thần thể thao. sports, /spɔːts/: các môn thể thao. sporting, /ˈspɔːtɪŋ/: (có) tính thể thao. sporty, /ˈspɔːti/: thích thể thao.
word formation.example: He is a talented sportsman. She’s a famous sportswoman. That sportsperson won gold. They showed great sportsmanship. I enjoy watching sports. He took a sporting chance. She wears sporty outfits.

word formation.meaning: (de)stabilise, /ˈsteɪbəlaɪz/: làm (mất) ổn định. (in)stability, /(ɪn)stəˈbɪləti/: (không) ổn định. stabiliser, /ˈsteɪbəlaɪzə(r)/: thiết bị ổn định. (de)stabilising, /ˈsteɪbəlaɪzɪŋ/: có tính (mất) ổn định.
word formation.example: The government aims to stabilise prices. There’s political instability in the region. The stabiliser kept the ship balanced. Those events were destabilising.

word formation.meaning: withstand, /wɪðˈstænd/: chịu đựng. withstood, /wɪðˈstʊd/: đã chịu đựng. standing, /ˈstændɪŋ/: tư thế đứng, địa vị. upstanding, /ʌpˈstændɪŋ/: thẳng thắn, đáng kính. outstanding, /aʊtˈstændɪŋ/: nổi bật. notwithstanding, /ˌnɒtwɪðˈstændɪŋ/: tuy nhiên.
word formation.example: These materials can withstand heat. She withstood all criticism. He has long-standing respect. He is an upstanding citizen. Her work is outstanding. Notwithstanding the delay, the work continued.

word formation.meaning: restate, /ˌriːˈsteɪt/: nhấn mạnh lại. overstate, /ˌəʊvəˈsteɪt/: phóng đại. understate, /ˌʌndəˈsteɪt/: nói giảm. statement, /ˈsteɪtmənt/: bản tuyên bố. understatement, /ˌʌndəˈsteɪtmənt/: nói nhẹ. overstated, /ˌəʊvəˈsteɪtɪd/: bị phóng đại. understated, /ˌʌndəˈsteɪtɪd/: bị giảm bớt.
word formation.example: She restated her position clearly. He overstated the facts. She tends to understate problems. The statement was official. Saying it's cold is an understatement. The importance was overstated. The issue was understated in the report.

word formation.meaning: unsteady, /ʌnˈstedi/: không ổn định, bất ổn. (un)steadily, /(ʌn)ˈstedəli/: một cách (không) ổn định, đều đặn.
word formation.example: The ladder is unsteady. He walked unsteadily after the fall.

word formation.meaning: stimulation, /ˌstɪmjʊˈleɪʃn/: sự kích thích. stimulant, /ˈstɪmjələnt/: chất kích thích. stimulus, /ˈstɪmjələs/: sự kích thích. stimuli, /ˈstɪmjʊlaɪ/: các tác nhân kích thích. stimulating, /ˈstɪmjəleɪtɪŋ/: kích thích, thú vị. stimulated, /ˈstɪmjəleɪtɪd/: bị kích thích.
word formation.example: Mental stimulation helps keep your brain sharp. Coffee is a common stimulant. Music acts as a stimulus. These lights are visual stimuli. The lecture was very stimulating. Her curiosity was stimulated by the mystery.

word formation.meaning: strengthen, /ˈstreŋθn/: gia cố, làm mạnh lên. strength, /streŋθ/: sức mạnh. stronghold, /ˈstrɒŋhəʊld/: thành trì. strongly, /ˈstrɒŋli/: một cách mạnh mẽ.
word formation.example: They aim to strengthen the economy. She showed great strength. The castle was a stronghold of the rebels. I strongly disagree with that view.

word formation.meaning: infrastructure, /ˈɪnfrəstrʌktʃə/: cơ sở hạ tầng. structural(ly), /ˈstrʌktʃər(ə)li/: (về) cấu trúc. (un)structured, /(ˌʌn)ˈstrʌktʃərd/: (không) có bố cục, cấu trúc rõ.
word formation.example: The country needs better infrastructure. The problem is structural. The meeting was unstructured and confusing.

word formation.meaning: substantiation, /səbˌstænʃiˈeɪʃn/: sự chứng minh. substantiate, /səbˈstænʃieɪt/: chứng minh. (in)substantial(ly), /(ˌɪn)səbˈstænʃl(i)/: (một cách) (không) đáng kể.
word formation.example: The theory lacked substantiation. Can you substantiate your claim? The cost is insubstantial.

word formation.meaning: suggestion, /səˈdʒestʃn/: sự đề nghị. suggested, /səˈdʒestɪd/: được đề xuất. suggestive(ly), /səˈdʒestɪv(li)/: (một cách) mang tính đề nghị. suggestible, /səˈdʒestəbl/: dễ bị ảnh hưởng.
word formation.example: She made a helpful suggestion. The solution suggested by the teacher was effective. He nodded suggestively. Children are highly suggestible.

word formation.meaning: sympathise, /ˈsɪmpəθaɪz/: thông cảm. sympathiser, /ˈsɪmpəθaɪzər/: người ủng hộ. (un)sympathetic, /ˌʌnsɪmpəˈθetɪk/: (không) đồng cảm. (un)sympathetically, /(ʌn)sɪmpəˈθetɪkli/: một cách (không) cảm thông.
word formation.example: I sympathise with your loss. She’s a known political sympathiser. The teacher was unsympathetic. He listened sympathetically.

word formation.meaning: talker, /ˈtɔːkər/: người nói. talkie, /ˈtɔːki/: phim nói. talkback, /ˈtɔːkbæk/: ý kiến đóng góp. talkative, /ˈtɔːkətɪv/: nói nhiều.
word formation.example: He’s a good talker. They watched an old black-and-white talkie. The show features a talkback segment. She’s very talkative.

word formation.meaning: tendency, /ˈtendənsi/: xu hướng.
word formation.example: There’s a growing tendency to work from home.

word formation.meaning: terrorise, /ˈterəraɪz/: khủng bố. terrify, /ˈterəfaɪ/: làm kinh hãi. terrorist, /ˈterərɪst/: kẻ khủng bố. terrorism, /ˈterərɪzəm/: chủ nghĩa khủng bố. terror, /ˈterər/: kinh hoàng. terrible, /ˈterəbl/: kinh khủng. terrific, /təˈrɪfɪk/: xuất sắc. terrifying, /ˈterəfaɪɪŋ/: kinh hoàng. terrified, /ˈterəfaɪd/: sợ hãi. terribly, /ˈterəbli/: rất, cực kỳ.
word formation.example: They tried to terrorise the public. The loud noise terrified the child. The terrorist was caught. The country faces terrorism threats. She felt pure terror. That movie was terrible. His performance was terrific. It was a terrifying experience. I’m terrified of spiders. He was terribly late.

word formation.meaning: thought, /θɔːt/: suy nghĩ, tư duy. thinker, /ˈθɪŋkər/: nhà tư tưởng. thinking, /ˈθɪŋkɪŋ/: tư duy. thoughtfulness, /ˈθɔːtfəlnəs/: sự chu đáo. thoughtlessness, /ˈθɔːtləsnəs/: sự vô tâm. (un)thinkable, /ʌnˈθɪŋkəbl/: (không) thể tưởng tượng. thoughtful(ly), /ˈθɔːtfl(i)/: (một cách) chu đáo. thoughtless(ly), /ˈθɔːtləsli/: (một cách) vô tâm.
word formation.example: He paused in thought. She’s a deep thinker. Creative thinking is valuable. Her thoughtfulness was appreciated. His thoughtlessness hurt her. That’s unthinkable! She acted thoughtfully. He spoke thoughtlessly.

word formation.meaning: threaten, /ˈθretn/: đe dọa. threatened, /ˈθretənd/: bị đe dọa. threatening(ly), /ˈθretnɪŋli/: (một cách) đe dọa.
word formation.example: He threatened to leave. The animals are threatened by extinction. She glared at him threateningly.

word formation.meaning: mistime, /ˌmɪsˈtaɪm/: định thời gian không đúng lúc. timer, /ˈtaɪmər/: bộ hẹn giờ. timing, /ˈtaɪmɪŋ/: sự tính toán thời gian. overtime, /ˈəʊvətaɪm/: làm thêm giờ. timetable, /ˈtaɪmteɪbl/: thời gian biểu. timeless(ness), /ˈtaɪmləs(nəs)/: (sự) vượt thời gian. (un)timely, /ˈtaɪmli/: (không) đúng lúc. timeless(ly), /ˈtaɪmləsli/: một cách vượt thời gian.
word formation.example: He mistimed the pass. Set the timer for 10 minutes. Her timing was perfect. I worked overtime last week. Check the class timetable. Her beauty is timeless. The rescue was timely. The book is timelessly relevant.

word formation.meaning: transition, /trænˈzɪʃn/: sự chuyển đổi. transitory, /ˈtrænzətri/: tạm thời. transitional, /trænˈzɪʃənl/: mang tính chuyển tiếp. transitionally, /trænˈzɪʃnəli/: quá độ, chuyển tiếp.

word formation.meaning: typeset, /ˈtaɪpset/: sắp chữ. typecast, /ˈtaɪpkɑːst/: đóng khung. typify, /ˈtɪpɪfaɪ/: điển hình. typist, /ˈtaɪpɪst/: người đánh máy. typewriter, /ˈtaɪpraɪtər/: máy đánh chữ. typeface, /ˈtaɪpfeɪs/: kiểu chữ. typesetting, /ˈtaɪpsetɪŋ/: sự sắp chữ. typesetter, /ˈtaɪpsetər/: thợ xếp chữ. typewritten, /ˈtaɪprɪtn/: được đánh máy. typical(ly), /ˈtɪpɪkl(i)/: (một cách) điển hình.
word formation.example: He learned to typeset pages. She was typecast as the villain. That style typifies the 80s. The typist finished quickly. I used a typewriter in school. This font uses a modern typeface. Typesetting takes skill. The typesetter adjusted the layout. The document was typewritten. She answered typically sarcastically.

word formation.meaning: uppermost, /ˈʌpəməʊst/: cao nhất. upright, /ˈʌpraɪt/: thẳng đứng, ngay ngắn. upward(s), /ˈʌpwəd(z)/: hướng lên trên. upwardly, /ˈʌpwədli/: hướng lên trên.
word formation.example: That was the uppermost shelf. Stand upright for posture. Look upward. Prices moved upwardly this quarter.

word formation.meaning: abuse, /əˈbjuːz/: lạm dụng. misuse, /ˌmɪsˈjuːz/: sử dụng sai, lạm dụng. reuse, /ˌriːˈjuːz/: tái sử dụng. overuse, /ˌəʊvəˈjuːz/: sử dụng quá mức. (ab)user, /ə(b)ˈjuːzər/: (người) sử dụng. usefulness, /ˈjuːsfəlnəs/: tính hữu dụng. usage, /ˈjuːsɪdʒ/: cách sử dụng. uselessness, /ˈjuːsləsnəs/: sự vô dụng. (un)used, /ˌʌnˈjuːzd/: (chưa) được sử dụng. (un)usable, /ˈjuːzəbl/: (không) thể sử dụng. reusable, /ˌriːˈjuːzəbl/: có thể tái sử dụng. abused, /əˈbjuːzd/: bị lạm dụng. abusive(ly), /əˈbjuːsɪv(li)/: (một cách) lạm dụng. usefully, /ˈjuːsfəli/: một cách hữu dụng.
word formation.example: He abused the system for personal gain. Misuse of funds led to legal action. We should reuse old containers. The overuse of antibiotics is dangerous. The app tracks each user’s time. This knife is known for its usefulness. Usage instructions are included. The tool’s uselessness made it obsolete. This coupon is unused. The material is unusable. These bags are reusable. The child was abused. He spoke abusively. She reacted usefully in the situation.

word formation.meaning: revalue, /ˌriːˈvæljuː/: đánh giá lại, nâng giá. overvalue, /ˌəʊvəˈvæljuː/: đánh giá quá cao. evaluate, /ɪˈvæljueɪt/: đánh giá. (re)evaluation, /ˌ(riː)ɪˌvæljuˈeɪʃn/: sự (tái) đánh giá. evaluation, /ˌɪvæljuˈeɪʃn/: sự đánh giá. overvaluation, /ˌəʊvərˌvæljuˈeɪʃn/: sự định giá quá cao. valuer, /ˈvæljuər/: người định giá. valuables, /ˈvæljəblz/: vật quý giá. (in)valuable, /ˌɪnˈvæljuəbl/: (vô) giá trị. valueless, /ˈvæljuləs/: không có tác dụng.
word formation.example: The currency was revalued. He tends to overvalue his input. They evaluate the project yearly. A reevaluation is needed. The evaluation took two days. That’s an overvaluation of the house. The valuer arrived late. Keep your valuables in a safe. Her advice was invaluable. That item is valueless now.

word formation.meaning: weight, /weɪt/: cân nặng. weightlifter, /ˈweɪtlɪftər/: vận động viên cử tạ. weightlifting, /ˈweɪtlɪftɪŋ/: môn cử tạ. weightiness, /ˈweɪtinəs/: tính quan trọng. overweight, /ˌəʊvəˈweɪt/: béo phì. underweight, /ˌʌndəˈweɪt/: nhẹ cân. (un)weighted, /ˈweɪtɪd/: (không) được cân. weightless(ness), /ˈweɪtləs(nəs)/: (sự) không trọng lượng. weighty, /ˈweɪti/: nặng, nghiêm trọng.
word formation.example: He gained a lot of weight. The weightlifter won gold. Weightlifting is his passion. Her words had great weightiness. He became overweight after the holidays. She is slightly underweight. The dice are weighted. The astronaut floated in weightlessness. That’s a weighty matter.

word formation.meaning: wilderness, /ˈwɪldənəs/: vùng hoang dã. wildlife, /ˈwaɪldlaɪf/: động vật hoang dã. wildness, /ˈwaɪldnəs/: tính chất hoang dã. wildly, /ˈwaɪldli/: điên dại, hoang dã.
word formation.example: They explored the wilderness. The park protects wildlife. The wildness of the storm was shocking. He danced wildly.

word formation.meaning: wisdom, /ˈwɪzdəm/: trí khôn, sự thông thái. (un)wise(ly), /ˈ(wɪz)(li)/: (một cách) (không) khôn ngoan.
word formation.example: He is full of wisdom. She acted unwisely in that situation.

word formation.meaning: reword, /ˌriːˈwɜːd/: diễn đạt lại, soạn lại. (re)wording, /ˌriːˈwɜːdɪŋ/: cách dùng từ (soạn lại từ). wordplay, /ˈwɜːdpleɪ/: chơi chữ. wordy, /ˈwɜːdi/: dài dòng. (re)worded, /ˌriːˈwɜːdɪd/: được diễn đạt (lại). wordless(ly), /ˈwɜːdləs(li)/: (một cách) không thể diễn tả bằng lời.
word formation.example: She reworded the sentence for clarity. The legal document needs careful rewording. The comedian is known for clever wordplay. His explanation was too wordy. The statement was reworded formally. He stared wordlessly at the scene.

word formation.meaning: rework, /ˌriːˈwɜːk/: làm lại. overwork, /ˌəʊvəˈwɜːk/: làm việc quá sức. worker, /ˈwɜːkər/: công nhân. works, /wɜːks/: tác phẩm. workplace, /ˈwɜːkpleɪs/: nơi làm việc. working, /ˈwɜːkɪŋ/: (thuộc) công việc. (un)workable, /ʌnˈwɜːkəbl/: (không) thể thực hiện.
word formation.example: We need to rework the design. She often overworks herself. The workers went on strike. His collected works are famous. Safety is important in the workplace. They discussed the working hours. That plan is unworkable.

word formation.meaning: worthlessness, /ˈwɜːθləsnəs/: sự vô dụng. worthy, /ˈwɜːði/: xứng đáng. worthless, /ˈwɜːθləs/: vô giá trị. worthwhile, /ˌwɜːθˈwaɪl/: đáng giá.
word formation.example: She felt a deep sense of worthlessness. He is a worthy opponent. That item is worthless now. Helping others is always worthwhile.

word formation.meaning: rewrite, /ˌriːˈraɪt/: viết lại. (re)wrote, /ˌ(riː)ˈrəʊt/: (đã) viết lại. (re)written, /ˌ(riː)ˈrɪtn/: (đã) được viết lại. writing(s), /ˈraɪtɪŋ(z)/: sự viết/bài viết. writer, /ˈraɪtər/: tác giả, nhà văn. unwritten, /ʌnˈrɪtn/: bất thành văn.
word formation.example: He had to rewrite the essay. She rewrote the ending. The script was rewritten for clarity. His writings are inspiring. She is a well-known writer. It’s an unwritten rule.

word formation.meaning: youngster, /ˈjʌŋstər/: đứa con, người trẻ. youth, /juːθ/: thanh xuân, tuổi trẻ. youthful, /ˈjuːθfl/: trẻ trung.
word formation.example: The youngster was eager to learn. She remembered her youth fondly. He has a youthful spirit.

word formation.meaning: zealot, /ˈzelət/: người cuồng tín, người quá khích. zealous(ly), /ˈzeləs(li)/: (một cách) sốt sắng, đầy nhiệt huyết.
word formation.example: The zealot refused to compromise. She supported the cause zealously.

word formation.meaning: avoidance, /əˈvɔɪdəns/: sự tránh. (un)avoidable, /əˈvɔɪdəbl/: (không thể) tránh khỏi. (un)avoidably, /ˌʌnəˈvɔɪdəbli/: (một cách không thể) tránh khỏi.
word formation.example: His avoidance of the issue was clear. The damage was unavoidable. The crash was unavoidably caused by the fog.

word formation.meaning: awfulness, /ˈɔːflnəs/: sự khủng khiếp. awesomeness, /ˈɔːsəmnəs/: sự tuyệt vời. awestruck, /ˈɔːstrʌk/: kinh ngạc. awfully(ly), /ˈɔːf(ə)li/: (một cách) kinh khủng. awesome(ly), /ˈɔːs(ə)mli/: (một cách) tuyệt vời.
word formation.example: The awfulness of the event shocked everyone. Her awesomeness was undeniable. He was awestruck by the view. It was awfully noisy. She danced awesomely.

word formation.meaning: disbelieve, /ˌdɪsbɪˈliːv/: không tin. belief, /bɪˈliːf/: niềm tin. believer, /bɪˈliːvər/: người tin tưởng. (un)believable, /ˌʌnbɪˈliːvəbl/: (không) thể tin được. disbelieving(ly), /ˌdɪsbɪˈliːvɪŋ(li)/: (một cách) không tin.
word formation.example: I disbelieve that rumor. He has a strong belief in honesty. She’s a true believer. That’s unbelievable! He looked at me disbelievingly.

word formation.meaning: beneficiary, /ˌbenɪˈfɪʃəri/: người hưởng lợi. beneficial(ly), /ˌbenɪˈfɪʃəl(li)/: (một cách) có lợi.
word formation.example: She’s the main beneficiary of the will. The program worked beneficially for all.

word formation.meaning: (de)briefing, /ˈbriːfɪŋ/: cuộc phỏng vấn, thẩm vấn. brevity, /ˈbrevəti/: sự ngắn gọn. briefs, /briːfs/: quần lót nam. briefly, /ˈbriːfli/: một cách vắn tắt.
word formation.example: The debriefing took an hour. The letter was praised for its brevity. He packed several briefs. She explained briefly.

word formation.meaning: brilliance, /ˈbrɪljəns/: sự tài giỏi. brilliantly, /ˈbrɪljəntli/: một cách giỏi giang.
word formation.example: Her brilliance impressed everyone. He played brilliantly.

word formation.meaning: broaden, /ˈbrɔːdn/: mở rộng. breadth, /bredθ/: chiều rộng. broadly, /ˈbrɔːdli/: một cách rộng rãi.

word formation.meaning: capability, /ˌkeɪpəˈbɪləti/: khả năng. incapable, /ɪnˈkeɪpəbl/: không có khả năng.

word formation.meaning: causation, /kɔːˈzeɪʃn/: nguyên nhân. causal, /ˈkɔːzl/: thuộc quan hệ nhân quả. causative, /ˈkɔːzətɪv/: là nguyên nhân gây ra.
word formation.example: The causation of the accident is unclear. There is a causal link between stress and illness. Smoking is a causative factor of cancer.

word formation.meaning: exchange, /ɪksˈtʃeɪndʒ/: trao đổi. changeover, /ˈtʃeɪndʒəʊvə(r)/: chuyển biến. (un)changing, /ˌʌnˈtʃeɪndʒɪŋ/: (không) thay đổi. (un)changeable, /ˌʌnˈtʃeɪndʒəbl/: (không) dễ thay đổi. interchangeable, /ˌɪntəˈtʃeɪndʒəbl/: có tính thay thế lẫn nhau.

word formation.meaning: disapprove, /ˌdɪsəˈpruːv/: không ủng hộ, không thông qua. (dis)approval, /ˌdɪsəˈpruːvəl/: sự (không) ủng hộ, thông qua. (dis)approved, /ˌdɪsəˈpruːvd/: (không) được thông qua. (dis)approving(ly), /ˌdɪsəˈpruːvɪŋ(li)/: (một cách) (không) tán thành.

word formation.meaning: architecture, /ˈɑːkɪtektʃə(r)/: kiến trúc. architectural(ly), /ˌɑːkɪˈtek.tʃər(ə)li/: (thuộc) kiến trúc.
word formation.example: The building is famous for its modern architecture. The city is architecturally diverse.

word formation.meaning: argument, /ˈɑːɡjumənt/: lập luận, lý lẽ. argumentative(ly), /ˌɑːɡjumənˈtetɪv(li)/: (một cách) thích tranh luận. (un)arguable, /ˈɑːɡjuəbl/: (không thể) bàn cãi. arguably, /ˈɑːɡjuəbli/: có thể cho là.
word formation.example: They had a strong argument. He answered argumentatively. That’s an unarguable fact. Arguably, she’s the best in the team.

word formation.meaning: rearrange, /ˌriːəˈreɪndʒ/: sắp xếp lại. (re)arrangement, /ˌ(riː)əˈreɪndʒmənt/: sự sắp xếp (lại). arranged, /əˈreɪndʒd/: được sắp xếp.

word formation.meaning: arts, /ɑːts/: nghệ thuật. artfulness, /ˈɑːtfəlnəs/: sự tinh ranh, khéo léo. artificiality, /ˌɑːtɪˌfɪʃiˈæləti/: tính nhân tạo, giả tạo. artist, /ˈɑːtɪst/: nghệ sĩ. artistic(ally), /ɑːˈtɪstɪk(li)/: (một cách) nghệ thuật. artificial(ly), /ˌɑːtɪˈfɪʃl(i)/: (một cách) giả tạo. artful(ly), /ˈɑːtfəl(i)/: (một cách) tinh vi. artless(ly), /ˈɑːtləs(li)/: (một cách) chân thật.
word formation.example: She studied the arts. His artfulness was impressive. The flower looked artificial. The artist displayed new work. She decorated the room artistically. It was artificially sweetened. He answered artfully. She sang artlessly.

word formation.meaning: reassess, /ˌriːəˈses/: đánh giá lại. (re)assessment, /ˌ(riː)əˈsesmənt/: đánh giá (lại). assessor, /əˈsesər/: người đánh giá. assessed, /əˈsest/: bị đánh thuế.
